Articles.Content:
Slowly putting this project together for funsies while I wait for 1.0.

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/6nKAR)

It deploys and lands nice enough from 30km circular orbit dropped to *just* suborbital (like the real deployment). Be careful though, it has a tendency to bounce, just like the real deal.

If anyone wants it, I'll post a dropbox

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-19T02:38:46Z" title="03/19/2015 02:38  AM" data-short="9 yr">March 19, 2015</time> by Himynameisjake**

Nice! I was wondering if a free-drop onto Gilly would be doable.

Looks good too!

> 
> Nice! I was wondering if a free-drop onto Gilly would be doable.
> Looks good too!

It's doable, you come in hot (somewhere around 23m/s) but those little legs handle the blow. If you're focused, you can almost negate the bounce, but you have to hit at just the right time. If you don't do anything, you'll bounce for ~30 minutes and still slide around when you land.
Why bother with the solar panels? You'll be permanently parked in shadow anyway ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif).
Nice Rossetta tribute, your Philae looks great! I like the drill a lot.

> 
> Why bother with the solar panels? You'll be permanently parked in shadow anyway ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif).

too soon 

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> Nice Rossetta tribute, your Philae looks great! I like the drill a lot.

Thanks!

Continuing the process, Rosetta taking shape: 

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/PlFhb)

Where are the ion engines on Rosetta? Other than that, the whole things looks pretty cool.

Rune. Keep it up!

> 
> Where are the ion engines on Rosetta? Other than that, the whole things looks pretty cool.
> Rune. Keep it up!

pretty sure rosetta is bipropellant? also, I put the engines (monoprop because they look the closest to her engines) clipped inside an RCS block to look even more realistic.

> 
> Where are the ion engines on Rosetta? Other than that, the whole things looks pretty cool.
> Rune. Keep it up!

Huh ? Rosetta only uses hypergolic fuel + oxydizer - through it's 24 10N pressure fed RCS nozzles.

Stationkeeping and propulsion is provided only by those ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Huh ? Rosetta only uses hypergolic fuel + oxydizer - through it's 24 10N pressure fed RCS nozzles.
> Stationkeeping and propulsion is provided only by those ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

good, i'm not crazy, you heard it here first.

Here's what those thrusters looks like ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

[http://cs.astrium.eads.net/sp/spacecraft-propulsion/bipropellant-thrusters/10n-thruster.html](http://cs.astrium.eads.net/sp/spacecraft-propulsion/bipropellant-thrusters/10n-thruster.html)

@Himynameisjake

If you need a more special way to have single RCS nozzles, you can surface attach a place-7 anywhere linear RCS port onto a LV-1R engine (with it's thrust set to 0) , then move the rcs port with the offset tool - and tada ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) a single rcs port with a nozzle ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

edit : here's an example of what i meant ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) maybe it can be of use to you ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

[![4JAPuSBm.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/4JAPuSBm.jpg)](http://imgur.com/4JAPuSB) [![GTKmYo5m.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/GTKmYo5m.jpg)](http://imgur.com/GTKmYo5)

> edit : here's an example of what i meant ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) maybe it can be of use to you ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
> 
> http://imgur.com/4JAPuSB[http://i.imgur.com/4JAPuSBm.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/4JAPuSBm.jpg) http://imgur.com/GTKmYo5[http://i.imgur.com/GTKmYo5m.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/GTKmYo5m.jpg)

Fun idea but I like the ability to fire it as a normal engine ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

you should still be able to use the LV-1R if you don't set it's thrust to 0 ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) although, you'll need to either surface attach the LV-1R to a fuel tank, or to use a fuel line between the tank and the LV-1R ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) but both operations at the same time would be possible ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
